comments.body: I really Like this idea

I would be glad if any block that is technicaly a stone variant would have Blocks like Base block cracked version polished version chiseled version polished bricks and stairs slabs walls and stuff for all of them
I made an addon for this so I would love to see Mojang's execution of this.
This should 100% be in the game. It fits vanila perfectly; the amount of mods, resource packs, datapacks and addons speak to themselfes.
This should 100% be in the game. It fits vanila perfectly; the amount of mods, resource packs, datapacks and addons speak to themselfes.

I've noticed that when banners are put on shields, the image is compressed to fit within the shield border, which can compress and distort the image. I think that the banner images should take up the entire shield. For example, if a banner has black trim, that trim would become the shields trim
I mainly want this so the Ominous Banner image is identifiable on my shield

Love this but I think it should be less costly, like just putting a shield and then one of the different material to create the trim look, so it's not as expensive and players aren't putting diamonds on their shields in hopes of boosting its power

I believe that shields should be of different quality depending on the material with which they were upholstered (copper, gold, iron, netherite) or fitted (leather, fabric from the banner).
I would also like to see a buckler in the game, the ability to install spikes on the shield, plates for catching an enemy blade, blades in the manner of haladi, claws.
It's all on the blacksmith's table.

What if instead of leading to pre existing structures, it can rarley lead you to a buried mega ruins which has tonnes of opportunity for more archeology and other loot perhaps, and this ruins is very rare so it is only realistic to find if you do archeology
They already deconfirmed this feature
Use mods for this.
This is possible, as you can use Bedrockâ€™s game layer system using external editing to create combined slabs.
and they could still make the bell noises!
I like this, maybe there could be different varieties of crystals (sapphire, ruby, emerald, etc.).
Yes! Make a lovely decoration!
This seems like a kind of weird mechanic, but it at least would make the telescope more interesting.

I think this is a great yet strange mechanic, but I have a few criticisms. One: If I am correct, the stars in the sky are the same for every player. This feature would best be implemented if stars were randomly generated per each Minecraft seed. If not one player could just map out and post online a bunch of constellations that everyone would use. Two: Other than the beauty constellations would have, their only other function would be navigation (how they are used in the real world). However, with items like the locator map, compasses, etc. (all which would be acquired before a telescope), this method of navigation would be woefully outmatched. Three (and last): The actual method described to map out constellations is not exactly intuitive; it would need some work.

I love the idea, it would definitely tie in with the lore themes brought by the archeology part of 1.17, but it ultimately needs rethinking if it were to be implemented.
i would make a constellation for each magic element with its own story!
Would be the same for other blocks that change according to biomes or other things.
Also be able to dig spawners and actually get the spawner block!
I thought this was a joke but actually a good idea
I really like this, cus it's not something you'd ALWAYS want to have on a tool, otherwise you'd get tons of overly specific types of blocks. It would be a godsend for terraforming though.

That wound be AMAZING!!!!!

 

But what about Silk Touch II
that's expensive. How about if you smelt a gold block you get a gold brick block, or you can craft a gold brick with four gold ingots.
I think he means like the stone brick crafting, four stone for four stone bricks
good idea!

I was going to make a similar post! Except we need this with all the relevant ore; Diamond, Gold, Lapis, Emerald, possibly even Redstone (as if it were a ruby). Shiny brick blocks please! I want to make a yellow-brick road lol.

I would absolutely LOVE a full brick set for gold blocks.
From stairs, slabs, walls, even a trapdoor.
Make genuine yellowbrick roads with it.
Now THIS is my kinda thing! Sideways/sticky Redstone! We can craft the Sticky redstone series the same way we craft sticky pistons: with the item itself and a slimeball.
You mean Spectral Arrow?
Interesting but makes sense
Interesting but makes sense
Interesting but makes sense
Maybe this version of the ender chest could interact with hoppers too

Also the crying enderchest could be accessed by multiple players, so they could share items
This could be done with teams - the items are shared with other members of your team
A Crying Obsidian Ender Chest could be like a public ender chest. It could happen when normal Ender Chests get damaged, retaining the ability to transport items but displaying them publicly

a community e chest would be really good however it should be really difficult to make

EG:8 netherite scraps surrounded by one eye of ender

Well, I'm almost 3 years late to the party. Feel like I have to comment though, that sounds like a brilliant idea and the other replies in this thread seem awesome. A community enderchest would encourage teamwork and reduce toxicity in online servers/realms. What a shame this is Minecraft Feedback, they don't actually acknowledge all you talented guys coming up with brilliant ideas.

Maybe people like us should code this and make a mod pack or something?

Ohhh! I thought of something! The crying ender chest can be used like a mail box! You can place it down and go inside the chest then put stuff in it and there will be a UI that says done, When your done putting stuff in it you can hit The Done UI and more UI will pop up saying all the players on the server or realm or world click one of them and that stuff will get sent to them.
Netherite Items should be smelted into a Netherite Scrap, with the scrap acting as a nugget.

How would this make netherite farmable? Ingots are made of 9 nuggets, and each piece of netherite gear contains 1 ingot. So if you smelt the gear, and get 1 nugget, you only have 1/9 of the original value. Therefore, you lose 88.88% of the ingot, due to the 1:9 ratio.

This would not make netherite farmable. Copper could also be thrown into the mix.

Maybe netherite nuggets can be used to "plate" tools - combine an iron sword with 0-5 netherite nuggets, depening on how much you plate it, the axe's durability and damage will increase - each nugget will increase the durability by 60%, and damage by 0.25 hearts.
Beautiful block
I like the one on the very left

What if this was a feature of the Wandering Trader? Currently the Wander Trader is kinda useless most the time, but the ability to sell off some items for nuggets/ingots/emeralds, and maybe even diamonds, could make them a lot more interesting.

Plus I think it would make sense for them to want to buy stuff from you, after all their goal is to pick up various different items in their travels and sell them.
imagine fishing 10 hours to get 0 tridents xD
I hate how this would encourage "farms", but I would love to have a better shot at getting a trident.
It would be a lot safer than having to fight a drowned armed with a trident.
this is especially valid now that drowned also have another use in the form of their copper drop. Tridents would be a very nice extra incentive to fish considering how little players do it now.
there is no way i could come up with something like this, cool idea!
So basically a water candle from Terraria

I can see the use for mob farms but what would the usual player use it for?

Maybe it improves enchanting, with the downside of getting a random curse if placed near an enchanting table for a little while. It would also require bypassing the light condition for mob spawning.

This is a really cool idea make it like torch with a black flame and a white smoke coming off! It would be a block you can't just break and take it, maybe requiring a special tool or item to obtain to make it less OP
I think there should be different candle effects as well, maybe obtainable by changing the colour of the candle? it would be hard to get because of the mobs spawning around it.
We now have regular candles, so it should be extremely op and hard to find
If you think about it. Target blocks are made of hay bales so there should be little hay bale stacks like in the new villages nearby the outpost so this is good logic.
Sounds great!
we don't even have a proper use for the blast furnace yet

To the person who said we don't have a use for the regular blast furnace... it smelts much faster than a regular furnace.  That seems like a nice proper use.  (I do wish it wouldn't accept items into the smelter that don't work in it... it would make it much easier to automate a multi-item cooking set up... you could run ores over the blast furnace first (so they would go in) and food would just shoot passed it to the regular furnaces in the line.
this would be GREAT and it's a good possibility to introduce such a thing.
Maybe you can only craft advanced items on it instead of a crafting table i.e. Eyes of Ender, Netherite armor and equipment, and end crystals.
Between being able to make your arrows more distinctive or alternative ways to make tipped arrows, I think dying the fletching seems better since you could have more individual or team based events.
Not just the arrow itself but also the particle effect that it makes
I think it would be cool if you can craft potions and arrows together with the table to make it easier to get arrows with effects
Although I like the idea and I thin they should add it, I also think they should a more important use alongside this idea.
Although I like the idea and I thin they should add it, I also think they should a more important use alongside this idea.
I also think that maybe the arrows could be shot with notes attached to them.
This would better to just be added as a function to the cauldron where you can already add potions to arrows
The fletching table should work to enhance the bow and crossbow or adding the quiver back to Minecraft.
colored target blocks will also be cool.

And make the fletching table so that we can modify the bow or arrow like in the smithing table.

I guess.
I don't think there's anything too game breaking with making infested stone obtainable, and there's so much pranking that could be done with it.

It would be awesome to be able to carry silverfish in your inventory via infested stone, especially if you could get infinite from a spawner in a stronghold. It opens up neat options for trolls, and maybe even a new pet.
What would it be used for though? As we now have beds
Could be the nether's obsidian, soulsand and sobsidian ya know?
It could be used for \ setspawn in the nether
Alternatively to existing as a new liquid, it could be bottled (for lubrication) and brewed with the splash effect (for use in combat)

If it just bursts into flame in the nether, bottles of it could be weaponized.
Just slippier flammable water. Would be great for mob farms as long as you keep it away from lava
It can also be a new and better fuel source
The farmer can sell it. At the same time, it will be bought by a tanner (for leather processing).
I think oil vials can be mixed with potions for a "sticky" effect.

Oil has such a wide range of uses that it is impossible to list them all. You can speed up minecarts ("by oiling the wheels"), make mechanisms silent, work with dyes, work on leather, process iron and copper products. Make fire traps. Recreate the "physics of ice".
